intro: Jasonia sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian Jasonia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Jasonia sicula is typically found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
